Title:
Phytophthora banihashemiana sp. nov., a homothallic species
from Christs thorn jujube nurseries
Abstract:
During 2011-2014 investigations of the causal agent of
crown and root rot of Ziziphus spina-christi (Christs thorn jujube) in
Fars Province of Iran resulted in isolation of a new Phytophthora
species. Morphological and physiological characteristics of the isolates
were somewhat similar to those of the species from Clade 4 in ITS tree
of Phytophthora spp. Analysis of the internal transcribed spacers of
rDNA sequences indicated that the isolates were distinct from Clade 4
species and they constituted a monophyletic lineage in ITS tree.
Phylogenetic analysis of other genes such as cytoplasmic NADH
dehydrogenase subunit I and cytochrome c oxidase subunit I, as well as
nuclear translation elongation factor 1α and β-tubulin were also placed
the distinct lineage in Clade 4 of the Phytophthora tree as a sister
taxon to P. plamivora. Investigation on the host range of the isolates
showed that they could infect some annual as well as perennial plants
other than Christs thorn. Based on phylogenetic analysis, and
morphological and physiological characteristics these isolates were
distinct from other Phytophthora species and resulted in introducing
Phytophthora banihashemiana sp. nov. as a new species.
